title: Riginac111
author: Riginac111
content: A seed phrase is very important to secure so that you will not lost your coin unaware. Some of us used a exchange wallet to save their coins and some times the newbies like us does not know the important of securing our wallet, I'm making this post because of my level mates that is ignorant of important of security in a wallet address. Many of us uses a remintano exchange wallet address to save our coins why they does not have a good quality of security like having a seed phrase in their wallet to security the coins.I brought this seed phrase matters to our local board so that we may realize our mistakes should in case some of us do keep coins in exchange, is not good to keep coins in exchange because when the exchange is on maintenance and without proper notification to the users of the exchange platform they will not have access to make withdrawal in the platform, and another thing that come to my mind is that keeping coins in exchange is at your own risky because the exchange can be hacked and your funds will not be find.I will like us to be using a wallet that have a seed phrase like Electrum wallet and other wallets you know that have a strong security to save your coins so that it will not be hacked or taken by another person. And it's good to secure our seed phrase and not to expose our seed phrase to the public because some of the seed phrase when you see another person's seed phrase you can import the wallet from another device and a coins in that particular wallet can be withdrawn to another wallet without your consent.Some of us that complained of missing of coin in a wallet, it happens that why it happened that coins missed in a Wallis because of exposing of seed phrase to the public, if we avoid storing our information on Internet and in our emails our seed phrase will not be exposed. This should be recommended for some one that want to save bitcoin 1. Ledger 2. Bitcoin core3. Ledger Nano4. Bitpay5. Crypto.com l DeFi Wallet6. Electrum

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Quote from: Victorybit1 on September 13, 2023, 07:38:35 PMCan you explain the process of creating and storing a secure seed phrase for a cryptocurrency wallet?Seed phrase are random generated words that serve as your wallet’s security.Open source wallets like electrum do generate seed phrase to you so that any time you are willing to access your Bitcoin in any device you can import these seed phrase and access your coin.Saving your seed phrase is very important that is why it always advisable to be saved offline to prevent hack of email or anywhere you save them online.You can write them down in a book or diary to save them, or make sure you write them on any place you know it is secure and less risky to anything like water, fire and so on to avoid been burnt or washed away by water.Using washers to save your seed phrase can be helpful but it is expensive, just as this thread by fillippone explain how it is been done here.

Ledger 2. Bitcoin core3. Ledger Nano4. Bitpay5. Crypto.com l DeFi Wallet6. Electrum Among all the wallets you mentioned, I will recommend Bitcoin Core and Electrum. Ledger and Ledger Nano are still the same wallets that you are referring to, they are one of the worst wallets so far. Not recommended.It is worth to know that Bitcoin Core or running your own Electrum server will require downloading of bitcoin blockchain which will require almost 500 gigabyte of data. It also needs around 5 to 10 gigabytes daily. This may not be the best choice for people in Nigeria because of poor electricity.

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on September 13, 2023, 08:41:23 PMIt is worth to know that Bitcoin Core or running your own Electrum server will require downloading of bitcoin blockchain which will require almost 500 gigabyte of data. It also needs around 5 to 10 gigabytes daily. This may not be the best choice for people in Nigeria because of poor electricity.We're talking about downloading 14 years of Bitcoin transaction history. Downloading Bitcoin core needs a good system speed, a good hard drive, and a solid internet connection. Do not even try to download Bitcoin core in Nigeria if you do not have a starlink internet connection. You might spend 2 weeks or months on a standby download using your Glo or MTN connection to be able to download Bitcoin core. It is possible to complete the task in 24-48 hours with a good system and hard drive and a solid internet connection. It is not necessary to run one. However, running a node benefits the network and increases your privacy.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Igebotz on September 13, 2023, 09:54:03 PMDo not even try to download Bitcoin core in Nigeria if you do not have a starlink internet connection. You might spend 2 weeks or months on a standby download using your Glo or MTN connection to be able to download Bitcoin core.It is not necessary to run one. However, running a node benefits the network and increases your privacy. It depends on your locations. There is MTN and Airtel 5G in Nigeria. Downloading it with 4G is not bad either if you have good internet connection in your area, but obviously it will take longer time. My MTN 4G router can reach up to 3 mbps in daytime, and more than 5 to 7 mbps at night, up to 13 mbps. 1 or 2 weeks to download it is not bad, almost 500 gigabyte is not small. Starlink is too expensive. If you are in a good MTN 5G location, it has been reportedly faster than Starlink, but it is not what we should compare because they are both supper fast, but Starlink has the advantage to reach more locations and hidden areas where MTN and others data providers in Nigeria may not reach with their services. If anyone do not want to download the whole blockchain, he can go for prune node. But downloading the full blockchain is better. After downloading the full blackchain and setting up the wallet or after setting up a prune node, all you need daily is not more than 10 gigabytes, 4G can handle that excellently, if the network is good.

comments.author: Mayor of ogba
comments.body: Utilizing a custodial wallet that you do not have access to its private key to store your Bitcoin is not a good practice because if anything happens to that centralized exchange like a hack you will not have access to your assets, and you will lose your assets if the centralized exchange can no longer pay it customers. Using Bitcoin comes with the risk of protecting your wallet from being compromised. When looking for a wallet to store your Bitcoin choose a noncustodial wallet that gives you full access to your Bitcoin any time you feel like accessing it, like an "electrum wallet" or the ones mentioned above. A wallet holds a piece of secret information called a private key or seed phrase it is your responsibility to protect your wallet's private key or seed phrase after creating a wallet and never share it with anyone. You can back up your wallet with a USB key, paper, and CDs and keep it in a location only known to you, with a wallet backup you can easily recover your wallet when you lose your device.

comments.body: Let me also comment on this topic because our experts have already given you the right answer.
